name: cottontail
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
a rabbit found in the US that is brown, with white underneath its tail: Owls prey on mice, cottontails, meadow voles, and rats. The backyard is like a wildlife preserve, full of cottontail rabbits and tree frogs.
More examplesFewer examplesIn the spring, the yard is hopping with cottontails.The marsh rabbit is a medium-sized cottontail with short, dark brown fur and a greyish-white belly.Species such as white-tail deer and cottontails have been found in historically forested regions of central Missouri.Adult pygmy rabbits are about a third the weight of more common cottontail rabbits.
